attributes.action: Conduct a full enquiry into the finacial failure of NCC and those responsible
attributes.background:
Northamptonshire county council have completely failed in their financial responsibilities.
 We would like a full transparent public enquiry into the failings who is responsible and why and how this happened, so it can prevented in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
With planned cuts likely to affect the vulnerable, we think everyone involved should be held responsible and those affected have clear answers as to how this happened.
What messures are the government going to take to provide basic human rights to those most likely to be affected?

attributes.action: Stop Ticket Touting and selling tickets above face value
attributes.background:
Ticket touting has to stop. Real fans are waiting an hour early to buy tickets only to be disappointed when all tickets are gone almost instantly. 

Ticket touts are using bots to buy a number of tickets only to sell them for 5x the amount on reseller sites such as Get Me In and StubHub.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand some people cannot make it to the gig and need to sell their tickets but in that case, they do not need to sell above face value. Touts should not be able to sell above face value + any transaction fees. 

To stop this, these reseller sites should be forced by law to only allow tickets to be sold at face value + any transaction fees and then add a small fee so that the site is still profitable. There is no reason for people to be selling tickets above face value even if they cannot attend an event.

Let's get this to parliament and force them to listen. Let's eliminate ticket touts from the industry and let real fans attend gigs again.

attributes.action: Change the Law, to stop authorities euthanising animals before an assessment.
attributes.background: Recently a dog was tied up and abandoned. The dog was labelled 'aggressive' so was shot dead, but we believe she was not assessed fairly.  We require a change of legislation to prevent animals being killed before a proper assessment has been done.
attributes.additional_details: We need a structured system in place to ensure that all authorities contact experienced capture teams and behaviourists as a first response. We want all authorities nationwide to be trained in awareness of who to contact as we believe the animal’s welfare should take priority in all situations regardless of breed.

attributes.action: Train Education Workers on School Refusal (condition) & Stop Attendance Fines
attributes.background: Education employees are actioning poor attendance through the penalty system as they don’t see School Refusal as a Mental Health issue. We would like to see staff, trained to recognise & act  accordingly as mental health is not a punishable condition
attributes.additional_details: School Refusal Support Services was set up to help & support families enduring this crisis in their child’s everyday life.Staff are misinterpreting what they see & instead see the child as a truant.Staff need to understand & be trained in the differences, have the skills to support families, recognise the child's needs, work with families to move forward & not apply fines.There is a plethora of feedback from parents to suggest that  un/diagnosed spectrum conditions underpin School Refusal.

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory prison sentence for vehicle theft.
attributes.background: Vehicle theft is increasing year upon year. The level of violence thieves are using, is also increasing. Thieves are entering residential homes solely to take vehicle keys.  Vulnerable mothers with children are being targeted.
attributes.additional_details:
David Jamieson, police and crime commissioner for the West Midlands: "Car thefts have doubled in two years – that’s an epidemic.

"This is making our lives really difficult. It’s sucking up loads of police time...”

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-england-44893229 

https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/cars/939651/stolen-car-theft-keyless-entry-hack-UK-risk/amp

https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/car-news/consumer-news/100213/uk-car-thefts-soar-by-56-per-cent%3famp

attributes.action: UK to refer Sri Lanka to ICC in March 2019
attributes.background: Refer Sri Lanka to International Criminal Court, if it continues to fail to implement its commitment made to the UNHRC Res. [A/HRC/RES/30/1] by March 2019; by agreeing to provide accountability and transitional justice.
attributes.additional_details: It has failed to implement the resolution and brazenly repudiated its commitments to the UNHRC and victims of the war, so far without consequence. In March 2018 UN Human Rights Commissioner Zeid Ra'ad Al Hussein has also explicitly expressed his frustration, having lost faith in Sri Lanka’s willingness to engineer transitional justice and has called on member states to “explore other avenues, including the application of universal jurisdiction,that could foster accountability.” the UN Deputy for Human Rights, Kate Gilmore called for the establishment of a Special Court.

attributes.action: Allow people to grow the Cannabis plant without a license!
attributes.background:
Licenses to grow the cannabis plant in the UK seem unjust, as you do not need this for other plants, even poisonous ones.
This safe plant is very therapeutic, nutritious and aesthetic, so remove this political policy.

attributes.action: Introduce MPs to represent the interests of British citizens living abroad.
attributes.background:
There are over five million British citizens living abroad. Their only recourse for representation in the UK is through their 'constituency' MP. 

This is not only unfair to constituency residents but citizens abroad who have legitimate concerns and issues which should be considered together.
attributes.additional_details:
It's not fair to any party that the vote and interests of someone in Spain carry the same priority as someone living in Edinburgh. This introduction will remedy a profound democratic deficit and also allow constituency MPs to focus exclusively on the issues of their area. 

There are already examples of this system working well - France and Macedonia have representatives for their overseas citizens.

attributes.action:
Abolish 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid spending
Spend OUR money at home
attributes.background:
The budget for Foreign Aid spending has increased to £14bn.
We believe that it is wrong that our own Government spends our taxes abroad when our NHS is in crisis and police budgets are under pressure. 
It is time to Stop the Foreign Aid Madness and spend OUR money at home on NHS and our police.

attributes.action: Ban hatching projects in schools
attributes.background: In these projects lots of the chicks become sick/deformed because their needs are not met during incubation or after hatching Their organs can stick to the sides of shells because the eggs are often not rotated properly Once over most of the chicks mainly males end up back in factory farming system
attributes.additional_details: It is important for children to learn about animals but if the way they are taught harms animals then something has gone  very wrong after the project has finished a high amount of the chicks are killed/ disposed of at poultry markets or fed to reptiles the lesson this kind of project teaches children is neither educational or compassionate since they often cause animals to suffer and treat living beings as disposable comodities the next generation deserve better than these misguided lessons

attributes.action: Make it possible for any baby to have a birth and death certificate after labour
attributes.background: Having gone through an early labour at 21 weeks and giving birth to a beautiful baby girl, who sadly died seconds after birth, I was heartbroken to realise that her short life would not be recognised legally on this earth with a birth and death certificate. This option should be available to parents
attributes.additional_details:
The current law in England and Wales is that in order to file a birth and death certificate the child must be born after 24 weeks of pregnancy.

The NHS currently offer a hospital-based commemorative certification, however this is not a legal document or proof of life and death. 

No matter the week of pregnancy any parents of a laboured birth should have the option to file for a birth and death certificate.

attributes.action: Do not ban the use and sale of E-Collars.
attributes.background: The government are calling for a ban on the use of "shock collars" more commonly known as E collars, branding them cruel. This is detrimental to many dogs, dog owners and rehabilators across the UK, and once the ban is implemented will follow with a rise in dog bites, rescues and deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
I can not stress enough the importance of not banning these tools, instead we should be sharing education on correct use. 
E-collars share many purposes: 
- A safety net for off lead sight hounds, hunting dogs and northern breeds well known for their lack of 're call. 
- To control security and protection trained dogs when off lead. 
- To control aggressive or reactive dogs who do not respond to positive only training methods. 
- Help protect live stock.

Please help responsible dog owners, and not prohibit the use of tools and training methods.

attributes.action: Off-Payroll: Give full rights to workers classed as ‘employed for tax purposes'
attributes.background: Newly proposed reforms to tax the self-employed – known as Off-Payroll Working - introduces rules that enable firms to classify workers as ‘employed for tax purposes’, without providing them with any employment rights. This is wholly unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
New measures in the Off-Payroll Working consultation effectively introduce a new 15% tax for self-employed workers, while enabling firms to circumvent their obligation to give employment rights to workers. This opposes the intentions of the Government’s ‘Good Work Plan’, designed to prevent unscrupulous firms forcing vulnerable workers into precarious work.
Parliament must ensure self-employed workers cannot be classed as ‘employed for tax purposes’ without receiving full employment rights.

attributes.action: Release the 'Implementation Unit Report on Shale Gas' (2016) immediately.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, demand that the above report is published unredacted to allow full scrutiny of all relevant issues by The Communities and Local Government (CLG) Select Committee inquiry into fracking, and to inform the public consultation on the draft National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF).
attributes.additional_details: In response to FOI requests by Sir Kevin Barron MP for this secret report to be made public, the Cabinet Office acknowledged that “decisions ministers make regarding fracking may have a significant impact on the lives of citizens.” However, the government refuse to publish this report on the grounds that doing so “could call into question the industry’s viability." We believe the public has a right to know what the government is withholding from the public. Read more here: https://goo.gl/Wbsg1r

attributes.action: Make our NHS hospital wards and waiting rooms across the UK infertile friendly.
attributes.background: There are 3.5m people affected by infertility in the UK. Yet their experience of our hospitals & surgeries only add to their grief and pain. Women who have suffered miscarriage, hysterectomies, gynae operations etc are placed in maternity wards/waiting rooms surrounded by pregnant women & babies.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking for:
•  Separate rooms where women can wait for appointments away from pregnant women, babies and pregnancy poster campaigns 
•  Separate wards for women miscarrying their babies away from pregnant women, babies and maternity wards
•  Separate rooms or wards for young women having had hysterectomies away from early pregnancy departments or maternity wards
•  New legislation that means all NHS departments and GP surgeries provide safe environments for the infertile

attributes.action: Make boxing safer/ Save lives
attributes.background: Make it the law that all boxing venues must have handheld brain scanners available, to save the lives of amateur and professional boxers and protect families from heartache.

attributes.action: Legal requierment for A/C to be working correctly on Public Service Vehicles
attributes.background: Working as a Bus Driver in London I frequently come across buses where the Heaters and/or Air Conditioning (A/C) is not working correctly as the operator is NOT legally required to maintain them. Therefore, I feel it’s about time that it is a legal requirement for Heaters and A/C to be working.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, you cannot transport cattle at temperatures higher than 30C, so why do people not have similar legal rights to travel in comfort. If you agree then please sign the petition and share.

attributes.action: Create a Freedom of Speech Act and Bring an End to "Hate Speech" laws
attributes.background:
Who defines "Hate"

For several years now the government has been infringing people's' most basic rights to speak freely on matters, by deeming their speech "offensive" or "hateful" and declaring that such speech, even online, warrants being fined or jailed. This is an outrage!
attributes.additional_details:
We demand the legal right to Free Speech, in an Act which will bring an end to the ludicrous notion that "hate speech" and "offensive speech" deserves people be imprisoned or charged. In short, an Act to codify the citizens' right to freedom of speech without government intervention.

Ideas must be fought with other ideas, not with force. 


Naturally this precludes that the current laws criminalizing "hate speech" be rescinded.

attributes.action: Petition calling for a review of Nottingham City Councils Selective Licensing.
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to carry out a review of Nottingham City Councils Selective Licensing Scheme.

We believe areas of Nottingham have been unfairly targeted and included in the Licensing Scheme which do not meet the government guidance conditions for Selective Licensing.
attributes.additional_details:
Particular areas such as the Park Estate, Mapperley Park, Wilford and the City Centre are examples of areas we believe have been wrongly included. They include modern apartment developments, affluent residential suburbs and luxury homes which do not meet any of the conditions for selective licensing.

We urge the Government to review the proposed scheme and the areas selected to ensure they do meet the Governments conditions for Selective Licensing before the scheme is allowed to commence.

attributes.action: Statutory periodic vision screening for all drivers during their driving life
attributes.background: The UK regulations are amongst the weakest in Europe relying on self-regulation and reporting. Road safety should start with good vision and current procedures lack any medical rigour to substantiate visual fitness to drive increasing the potential for injury or death due to accidents.
attributes.additional_details:
WHO declared poor vision is one of the main risk factors for crashes.

A 2014 Brake study showed 1.5 million UK drivers have never had an eye test.

Visit www.drivingblind.org.uk to rally support.

attributes.action: Require drivers to report a cat hit on the road
attributes.background: My cat was killed in a road accident, however this was not reported to the police, because this is not required by law. If a driver hits some animals they must report it to the police or face a £5000 fine, but this law doesn't cover cats. That should change.
attributes.additional_details:
The law as it stands:
 
If you hit an animal which is covered by The Road Traffic Act 1988 – namely, dogs, goats, horses, cattle, donkeys, mules, sheep and pigs you are legally required to report it to the police. But if you hit an animal not mentioned in the Road Traffic Act eg. a cat you are not required by law to report it.

attributes.action: Save our pets from death on the roads Don't Ban Containment Systems
attributes.background: The Government has started a consultation on banning electronic training aids for cats and dogs. It is vital that containment systems do not get caught up in any ban. These systems save the lives of thousands of cats and dogs each year. Over 250,000 cats & countless dogs are run over on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: In 2007 DEFRA commissioned a study into the use of Electronic Pulse Training Aids. This study specifically excluded containment fences. The highly regarded Companion Animal Welfare Council's in-depth study of June 2012 concluded that it was not possible to formulate an evidence-based argument against the use of Electric Pulse Training Aids (EPTAs). In 2016 research from Lincoln University into cat containment "No evidence of long-term welfare problems with electronic containment of cats"

attributes.action: Give a mandatory lifetime driving ban for causing death by dangerous driving
attributes.background: Nick Farrimond (35) was killed on the 29th August 2016 by a driver who was convicted and imprisoned for causing death by dangerous driving. He was under the influence of drugs and alcohol. He was also given a ten year driving ban which means he can drive again and could go out and do it again

attributes.action: Get independant panel research into vaccine damage in dogs and review protocol.
attributes.background:
Lepto vaccines are believed to be responsible for the serious illnesse/ death of dogs.
Major et al. (2014) investigated an outbreak of Lepto in Bern Switzerland.  298 dogs found with Lepto. Vaccination history was available for 251 of these dogs (84.2%) Of these 95% were fully vaccinated.
attributes.additional_details:
Distemper, Hepititis and Parvovirus are all conditions which can be tested for, a titre test would be healthier and safer than just routinely repeating the vaccine. 
Dogs can be FULLY VACCINATED AND STILL CONTRACT THESE CONDITIONS due to vaccine failure or high immunity carried by the dam. Therefore just blindly vaccinating does not work. 

We believe an independant panel will take a realistic view of the true dangers of vaccination.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory that new borns have a heart scan before leaving hospital
attributes.background: Lots of new born babies are sent home from hospital with serious heart problems, which, are not known about until it’s too late. My youngest son was sent home with heart defects which were not picked up until he was two weeks old & required surgery almost immediately. This could’ve been prevented.
attributes.additional_details: When we were in the specialist heart hospital, there were many children coming in, with a late diagnosis. This can be very fatal and stressful. We didn’t know anything about the heart so we had to learn about this too. Having a heart scan like an echo would detect any problems or issues. The faster it’s picked up, the better. Specialists can be involved straight away with the correct care needed. An echo will take 15 mins. I would rather spend 15 mins extra knowing my child’s heart was healthy.

attributes.action: Introduce seller identity check and records of item for cash for gold shops
attributes.background:
There have been nationwide burglaries targeting Asian families perceived due to Asian families having Gold in their houses.
The burglaries can be life threatening.
Police have difficulty in finding the stolen items and as gold can be cashed in easily after melting.
attributes.additional_details:
Asian families are seen to be targeted for gold in their homes.
New controls be put in place to oblige the buyers of gold for cash to establish the identity of the seller, information of the source of the object, a requirement to retain the item at the outlet and to record the transaction, as well as provide police with access to items and records.
Police should be given  adequate powers of access, questioning, 
arrest .

There are similar laws in Australia and Ireland .

attributes.action: Formally request the EU allow UK citizens to request EU citizenship after Brexit
attributes.background:
It is clear that only 36% of the UK population voted for Brexit despite the more publicised voter turnout of 51.89% leave voters

The EU would agree that 64% of UK citizens (quite possibly more now) would like to remain or at the least retain EU citizenship as they oppose solo UK citizenship

attributes.action: Abolish ASPA Section 24, the secrecy clause for animals used in UK laboratories
attributes.background: Four years after the Government undertook a public consultation review of Section 24 of the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986, the results are yet to be published. Animals continue to suffer and be subjected to inhumane procedures in UK labs, shielded from public scrutiny by this clause.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 24 contradicts the UK’s right to freedom of information and is at odds with commitments to transparency and public accountability within EU Directive 2010/63 on animals in research. Its repeal was widely supported by the House of Lords Select Committee and Animal Procedures Committee. Only abolition will allow public bodies access to challenge licences and decrease the unnecessary suffering of animals in the name of research.
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/research-and-testing-using-animals

attributes.action: Bring forward the implementation of 2% BIK for electric vehicles to April 2019
attributes.background: The government want to encourage the uptake of electric vehicles to help reduce CO2 and improve the environment.  Benefit in Kind for electric vehicles is due to fall to 2% in April 2020 which will help with this. However it is due to rise to 16% in April 2019.
attributes.additional_details: Currently electric vehicles, particularly those with longer ranges that may suit company car users better, typically have a higher purchase cost than petrol or diesel cars.  Company car users typically keep the same car for 3 years so those making decisions now are likely to avoid electric vehicles because of the increased BIK in 2019.  Bringing the 2% BIK forward to April 2019 would mean that the company car users would be much more likely to choose an Electric Vehicle now.

attributes.action: Swansea Bay Tidal Lagoon: make it happen.
attributes.background: The delay on going ahead with the Swansea Bay Tidal Lagoon should be addressed. Everyone needs to understand why and how this project benefits the whole of Britain. As well as protecting our environment and addressing rising energy demands in near future not to mention generations to come.
attributes.additional_details: https://drive.google.com/file/d/12gAbollr0p4JOz-no2COcsLNRk4a8UV0/view

attributes.action: Make Legal Aid available for applicants forced to prove immigration status in UK
attributes.background: The Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 saw Immigration being taken ‘out of scope’ for legal aid from 01.04.2013. This has affected people forced to prove their Immigration status in the UK, despite living here lawfully, including the Windrush era and their families.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls on the Government to make Legal Aid available to all applicants who are now forced to prove their Immigration status in the UK and to help them secure confirmation of their entitlement to British citizenship.

attributes.action: To make labeling commercial food as vegetarian and/or vegan a legal requirement
attributes.background: Some products on assumption may appear vegetarian/vegan, but when read closely they contain traces of animal produce. It seems reasonable to impose this requirement on the grounds that collectively speaking,it is incredibly time consuming not to mention unpractical for those who require visual aid.

attributes.action: Implement a statutory body to address animal abuse and prosecutions
attributes.background: The animal welfare crisis is spiralling out of control the government are in denial,enforcement and prosecution is lacking on a large scale.Animals need a robust and enforced system.It must move on from private prosecution and the state should prosecute as it does in every other area of the law.

attributes.action: Add Fibromyalgia & Rheumatoid Arthritis to NHS exemption fee list
attributes.background: Many diagnosed with these medical conditions both of which are non cureable need medication in order to have a liveable/maybe manageable quality of life.

attributes.action: Ban MMA nail products from the nail industry.
attributes.background: MMA can be found in NSS salons. You will see on your local high street, you can walk in, It’s a rushed service, they always hurt your nails with use of the electric file on the natural nail, which gives this tool a bad rep. MMA use had been around for years. products containing MMA sell for less!
attributes.additional_details: MMA is most widely used bone & dental products! It’s used to fix broken bones & create dentures. The reason your natural nail is thinned so much prior to the application is because the product doesn’t adhere very well to the nail unless it’s thinned. This weakens your own natural nail & you would notice MMA nails are extremely tough and very difficult to break. I’ve known of people having to go to A&E because the nail is so badly damaged that they’ve had to have it surgically removed.

attributes.action: Stop Southeastern Trains (Govia) from being awarded  franchise renewal.
attributes.background:
Southeastern / Govia have bid to renew their contract from December 2018.  
Despite making a £150 million profit they offer a poor and unacceptable service to their passengers.
Transport Secretary needs to be aware of how bad the service provided by Southeastern is.
attributes.additional_details:
- Daily repetitive train delays
- Unfair practice to stop delay repay
- Difficulty in applying for delay repay
- Short formed trains daily 
- Lack of working and clean toilets 
- % of cancelled trains daily 
- Lack of communication to passengers for delayed trains 
- Conflicting information to passengers 
- The Lewisham stranded train fiasco
- Increasing costs for a service which is decreasing and not acceptable for what passengers / commuters pay

attributes.action: Preserve the rights of EU citizens to stand and vote in local elections.
attributes.background:
Fair and effective local democracy depends on having certainty over who can stand and vote in local elections.

Government should make a commitment, now, that all EU citizens legally resident in the UK should retain their rights to stand as candidates and vote in council elections after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
An urgent commitment is needed because political parties and independent candidates are already making preparations to campaign in the May 2019 local elections.

Note that this petition is silent about EU residents' rights to remain in the UK.  (That matter, unhelpfully, is still unresolved at the time of writing.)

This petition assures political rights to those EU citizens who are granted, or retain, legal rights to reside in UK.  The criteria for those residency rights is a separate matter.

attributes.action: Immediately Review the Pubs Code
attributes.background: After 12 years of campaigning, the Pubs Code came in to practice July 2016. It was meant regulate the pubs industry and curb some of the unfair practices carried out by pub owning businesses that negatively affect pub tenants and the wider pub industry. It is not working and urgently needs reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: The Government set a review date of July 2019 to assess the efficacy of The Pubs Code. The failure of the Code has been so catastrophic it is imperative that the Government step in early and strengthen the grey areas of the Code. The simple argument is that an adjudicator has no legal powers, so the cash-rich pub owning companies are simply taking all the significant rulings made by the Pubs Code Adjudicator to the High Court and having them overturned.

attributes.action: Low cost path to CITIZENSHIP for all EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status
attributes.background: The Windrush crisis has shown that it is critical to provide fair protection for any of the 3 million law abiding EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status who contribute so much who consider the UK their home and contribute so much to our communities and Britain as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: EU Citizens without British Citizenship make a large net contribution to the UK in economic terms ( https://eu-rope.ideasoneurope.eu/2017/10/30/eu-migrants-give-take/ ) and so many other ways. The Windrush Crisis has shown that there can be no confidence in the promises made by the UK government when it comes to the protection of their rights. It is therefore critical that a low cost and simple path to citizenship is given to EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status.

attributes.action: Routinely test pregnant women for infections such as Group B Strep and more.
attributes.background: October 2017 the devastating news no parents want to here “your daughters heartbeat has gone”. I was suffering with an infection and Sepsis, while showing no early symptoms no one could of known I was ill with an infection, until they did a swab whilst in labour.
attributes.additional_details:
During pregnancy infections can be deadly to both baby and the mother, if my infection was picked up sooner It possibly could of been prevented and antibiotics could of been provided.

Infections during pregnancy are common such as Staphylococcus aureus and Group B Streptococcus. The NHS don’t routinely swab for any infections. If I had been tested around my due date when I'd been given the option to have an examination my infection possibly could of been prevented and any other infections could of possibly been picked up. If an examination is being taken place then a swab could be conducted to pick up any possible infections and stop babies, mothers becoming ill and prevent these types of stillbirths.

attributes.action: Launch an independent inquiry into the 5g Health & Safety risks
attributes.background: There seems to be much proof of the dangers of Mobile Phone masts as it is, and now 5g is to be rolled out with a far greater percentage of phone masts on every street in order to facilitate it. This is, given the evidence so far, a grave risk to each and every person in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Devra Davis
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BwyDCHf5iCY
Brain Tumours Links to Mobile Phone Use
https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/39/3/675/631387
Italian Court Rules Mobile Phones Cause Cancer
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/apr/21/italian-court-rules-mobile-phone-use-caused-brain-tumour

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background: Our government is not able to make decisions based on the will of the people because it has to get backing and approval from the House of Lords, an unelected chamber that does not reflect the will of the people. True democracy means that we should be able to vote for all members of parliament.

attributes.action: Extend gender pay gap reporting rules to cover ethnicity pay gap
attributes.background: In April 2017, the government put into law a practice where employers with 250 or more employees must publish and report specific figures about their gender pay gap. We the undersigned call on the government to extend these reporting rules to ethnicity pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
Several companies and institutions have voluntarily published ethnicity pay gap data, which suggests ethnicity pay gap is as much of a problem as gender pay gap.

Tackling ethnicity pay gap is a national issue, and by making reporting on them mandatory, will, as with requirements to report gender pay gap, provide focus and momentum to enable positive change.

attributes.action: Condemn the Faroe Islands for allowing the slaughter of endangered Cetaceans.
attributes.background: Every year, up to 1,000 migrating Pilot Whales and other dolphins are hunted and brutally killed in the Faroe Islands in a practice known as the ‘Grindadráp’ (or Grind). The cruel practice continues with the support of the Danish government, in conflict with their international legal obligations.
attributes.additional_details:
"An EU directive prohibits member states from all forms of deliberate disturbance, capture, or killing of cetaceans, however Sea Shepherd has evidence proving that Danish officials from the police, navy, and customs have been facilitating and even actively participating in the Grind." Sea Shepherd UK. 
We demand condemnation and ceasing of tourism and trade relations with the Faroe Islands until the Grind is ended in perpetuity. All evidence available to view on Sea Shepherd UK's Facebook page.

attributes.action: Once the Brexit process is finished give the public the final say on the deal
attributes.background: Once the process is all finished give the public the final say on it give them three simple choices: take the deal, meaning we leave with that deal; reject the deal and leave with no deal; or reject the deal and stay in EU.

attributes.action: Prime Minister to establish Windrush Day as a national day celebrating migration
attributes.background: Britain has been an island for over eight millennia, and over this period many have travelled here to make it their home. The arrival of the MV Empire Windrush on 22nd June 1948 heralded the first known mass migration to this island and marked a step change in the story of migration to Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
22nd June each year should be recognised as Windrush Day - a National Day of commemoration and celebration of migration and migrant communities in Britain.The Windrush Generation are part of the public memory of British history and achievement and thus should never be treated as criminals or easy targets as part of the current hostile immigration environment.

www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/may/09/windrush-shaped-britain-70-years-immigration-national-holiday

attributes.action: Legislation ensuring airlines must seat vulnerable people with their guardians
attributes.background: When booking a flight it should be guaranteed within the price that vulnerable people and young children are seated with their parent/guardian/carer and not exposed to risk of harm by separation on the plane. Protection of children is a right & not a privilege that can be purchased as an "add on"
attributes.additional_details: Airlines are exploiting a human right for vulnerable people to be protected by charging additional for seat allocation on a first come first served basis  and are avoiding responsibility for the safety of ALL passengers. Inevitably a vulnerable person will be abused, assaulted , bullied on an airline and the question asked will be "why were families or vulnerable separated". With modern booking systems there is no reason why seat allocation can't be made within the price in the first instance

attributes.action: Leave the EU now
attributes.background:
The Government is not going to achieve a satisfactory outcome from its negotiations with the EU. 
We should walk away now. 
No Deal is better than a bad deal.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 Developers Demolishing the *Wet Woodland* area at Denham Country Park
attributes.background: Wet Woodland should be protected by law! The area is clearly wet woodland, but not being recognised as such. There are approximately 2000 different wild species in this area. Once these areas are gone, they are gone for good!!
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be No Net Loss of biodiversity in London. We and our future generations cannot afford to lose these areas which are important for air/water quality and for general mental wellbeing of those that use these spaces. 

The Mid-Colne Valley Site of Metropolitan Importance (SMI) for nature conservation is too important to be lost. Priority habitats and species must not be swept under the carpet.

Wet woodlands are UK most productive habitats equal to our rain forests there are not many left in London.

attributes.action: Urge the FCA to cap repayments on rent-to-own and doorstep lending
attributes.background: The Sun is calling for a cap on the total cost of rent-to-own loans and doorstep lending at double the original item price or loan amount. This was introduced for payday loans in 2015 and the numbers of people struggling with unmanageable debts to those lenders has more than halved.
attributes.additional_details:
People on the lowest incomes, living in the poorest places, are paying a poverty premium - around 7 million people have resorted to high-cost credit. People whose wages or benefits don't stretch far enough need to borrow from rent-to-own or doorstep lenders to help pay for things such as an unexpected bill or to furnish their homes. These come with exorbitant rates of interest - more than 1,500% in some cases of doorstep lending. 
It's time to stop the credit rip-off.
